DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: KOZAK, D. V.;Kozak, Dalton V.;Kozak, Dalton Vinicius

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduado em Engenharia de Aeronáutica (ITA) e em Engenharia Química (PUCPR). Mestre em Ciências (ITA) e Doutor em Engenharia (UFPR). Engenheiro de propulsão (Avibrás Aeroespacial e IAE, SJC/SP). Professor universitário (PUCPR, UFPR, Uninter, UniDomBosco). Analista, gerente de projetos e consultor na área de desenvolvimento de software. Consultor na área de certificação de aeronaves. Diretor nas empresas DWK Consultoria e Treinamento (www.dwkl.com.br) e Sapiens Global (www.sapiensglobal.com).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduated in Aeronautical Engineering (ITA) and Chemical Engineering (PUCPR). Master of Science (ITA) and Doctor of Engineering (UFPR). Propulsion engineer (Avibrás Aerospace and IAE, SJC / SP). University professor (PUCPR, UFPR, Uninter, UniDomBosco). Analyst, project manager and consultant in the area of software development. Aircraft certification consultant. Director at DWK Consultoria e Treinamentos (www.dwkl.com.br) and Sapiens Global (www.sapiensglobal.com).

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Física dos Fluídos, Física de Plasmas e Descargas Elétricas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. 
The aerothermodynamic characteristics of the Brazilian satellite SARA (Portuguese abbreviation: SAtélite de Reentrada Atmosf´erica) was calculated for the orbital flight and atmospheric re-entry conditions using the Direct Simulation Monte Carlo method and considering a diatomic gas. Such an approach implies a consideration of internal modes of molecule energy in the intermolecular interaction, namely the rotational energy. The numerical calculations were carried out in a wide range of gas rarefaction embracing the free molecule and hydrodynamic regimes. Two values of the Mach number were considered: 10 and 20. Numerical results include the drag force of the satellite, the energy flux, pressure coefficient and skin friction coefficient over the satellite surface, the density and temperature distributions, and streamlines of the gas flow around the satellite. Influence of the satellite temperature upon these characteristics is evaluated for different values of the satellite temperature.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract. 
The aerothermodynamic characteristics of the Brazilian satellite SARA (Portuguese abbreviation: SAtélite de Reentrada Atmosf´erica) was calculated for the orbital flight and atmospheric re-entry conditions using the Direct Simulation Monte Carlo method and considering a diatomic gas. Such an approach implies a consideration of internal modes of molecule energy in the intermolecular interaction, namely the rotational energy. The numerical calculations were carried out in a wide range of gas rarefaction embracing the free molecule and hydrodynamic regimes. Two values of the Mach number were considered: 10 and 20. Numerical results include the drag force of the satellite, the energy flux, pressure coefficient and skin friction coefficient over the satellite surface, the density and temperature distributions, and streamlines of the gas flow around the satellite. Influence of the satellite temperature upon these characteristics is evaluated for different values of the satellite temperature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Rarefied gas flow through a thin slit at an arbitrary pressure ratio

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: European Journal of Mechanics. B, Fluids

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Física dos Fluídos, Física de Plasmas e Descargas Elétricas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract.
Rarefied gas flow through a thin slit is studied on the basis of the direct simulation Monte Carlo method. The flow rate and flow field are calculated over the whole range of gas rarefaction for various values of the pressure ratio. It is found that at all values of the pressure ratio a significant variation of the flow rate occurs in the transition regime between the free-molecular and hydrodynamic regimes. In the hydrodynamic regime, the flow rate tends to a constant value. In the case of finite pressure ratio, the flow field qualitatively differs from that for outflow into vacuum, namely, vortices appear in the down-flow container in the vicinity of the hydrodynamic regime. Then, in the hydrodynamic regime the gas flow forms a strong jet.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Integral Method Applied to the Calculation of Separation Point and Base Pressure of Inclined Wedges at Supersonic Speeds

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Plano de certificação da aeronave agrícola PL-010 Curiango

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Serviços de arquitetura e engenharia; testes e análises técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
DOCUMENT PURPOSE
The main purpose of this report is to document the certification procedures to be used during the PL-010 AG CurianGo Type Certification Process, based in the working arrangements already agreed during some preliminary meetings held with ANAC.
Therefore, it is considered that the working arrangements defined in this initial phase of the certification process will be established by ANAC and PLANAIR in order to increase the efficiency of both parties and make a commitment of reaching the program milestones in an appropriate time.
This report presents:
· the RBHAs/FARs that were evaluated to be complied with during the PL-010 Ag CurianGo development;
· the Means of Compliance (MoC) for each identified requirement;
· the intent of rule for each requirement, where applicable;
· the activities to be performed by applicant in order to demonstrate compliance with the applicable requirements;
· the reports where the results of compliance activities will be documented;
· the intended schedule for obtaining the type certificate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: Performance, Controllability, Handling and Flight Characteristics of PL-010 Curiango

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Serviços de arquitetura e engenharia; testes e análises técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
REPORT ABSTRACT
In this report the main aerodynamic, performance and stability characteristics of PL-010 Ag are determined using well known methodologies from literature. Most requirements referenced in this report has compliance indicated by calculation/analysis, but they require flight test substantiation (as indicated in Table 4-1, pg. 4-1). Other requirements are demonstrated by direct measurement; this is the case for weights and center of gravity position.
